CHAPTER 8

SLEEP

Protect the Asset

EACH NIGHT, WHEN I GO TO SLEEP, I DIE.  

AND THE NEXT MORNING, WHEN I WAKE UP, I AM REBORN.  

—Mahatma Gandhi  

Geoff sat straight up in bed, in a panic.  

He felt as if a bomb had exploded in his head.  

He was sweating and discombobulated.  

He listened intensely.  

What was going on?  

Everything was silent.  

Perhaps it was a weird reaction to something he’d eaten.  

He tried to go back to sleep.  

The next night it happened again.  

Then a few days later it happened in the middle of the day.  

He had just returned from India.  

At first, he thought it might be a reaction to malaria medicine.  

He was taking it with Benadryl for jet lag.  

But as his situation worsened, it became more complicated.  

It felt like he was experiencing anxiety attacks.  

But he had no anxiety—just the physical symptoms.  

Geoff was a textbook overachiever.  

He had a deep desire to make a difference.  

His grandfather was an early administrator in the Peace Corps.  

Geoff was fiercely ambitious and driven.  

He was committed to making a contribution to the world.  

He was on the board of Kiva.  

He had been named Ernst and Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year.  

He was a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum.  

He was the co-founder of a successful impact investment fund.  

He was the CEO of a global microcredit organization.  

That organization reached more than 12 million poor families worldwide.  

He was thirty-six years old and on top of his game.  

Geoff traveled constantly.  

This often made sleep difficult.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Geoff, a high-achieving CEO, experiences severe health issues due to his relentless travel and lack of sleep.
